intro: Styphelia globosa, commonly known as the globular heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Styphelia globosa is an evergreen shrub that produces small, leathery leaves and blooms from late spring to early summer.
